text: A signature dish of Colima, tatemado features pork marinated in vinegar and spices, then slow-cooked until tender. Rich, aromatic, and deeply satisfying, it’s a celebration of traditional cooking techniques and bold flavors.

This hearty soup is made with freshwater shrimp, tomatoes, garlic, and local spices. Served hot and fragrant, it’s a beloved comfort food that connects diners to Colima’s rivers and culinary heritage.
Sweet coconut treats made with piloncillo and baked to golden perfection. These chewy delights are popular in local markets and festivals — a simple yet irresistible taste of Colima’s sweeter side.
